instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
I have a Macbook Air A2179 (820-01658-A) had water damage but no obvious water damage signs.

[LIST=1]
[*]The Green light on the charge stays comes on and the fan spins
[*]The Macbook battery has 10Volts
[*]No light when  USB Charger plugged in and won't boot off battery motherboard completely dead
[/LIST]
I don't have a boardview for this motherboard. I am new to macbook repairs so please been patient with me but please know that I have some electronics experience from repairing laptops.

Thanks
Antony

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
You need to find a similar schematic.
Did you look at 820-01521?

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I now have the schematic,  820-01521-02 , I am new to macbook repair so where do I start testing?

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
Which is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage?
Do you get 3V3_G3?

Check if all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are present.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: PPBUS_G3H  has 10.43 when USB C plugged in but has no voltage when battery plugged in on its own, not sure about  SLPS2R and awake voltages as I don't know what to look for on the boardview when searching for  SLPS2R  for example it comes up with many names (see pdf attached)

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
Of course, there are several rails for mentioned names; maybe 5, or more.
Just check if you get these voltages.
No need to check in different points for the same rail.

10.43V on PPBUS_G3H without battery???

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I don't get any voltage on  PPBUS_G3H when on battery alone

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: Post exact PPBUS_G3HV with charger and also w/ and w/o battery connected.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H with charger only 12.61 Volts
PPBUS_G3HV with charger and battery 10.41 Volts and rising
PPBUS_G3HV with battery only 10.42 Volts

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: Is there a list of common voltages for Macbook boards?

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
Seems that you don't want to search for mentioned voltages.
Try to put the machine in DFU mode.
If these voltages are present, then you should be able to do it.

Search on the forum, we have many posts with usefull information.
Be aware, many people complained about how difficult is to reach DFU.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
You Wrote "Seems that you don't want to search for mentioned voltages. " are you referring to a previous post 
"
Do you get 3V3_G3?
Check if all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are present. " 

if so then I did ask for more clarification as I don't know where I would find them and what they are called on a boardview?

The DFU mode does not work as the machines does not even power on , no fan spin

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
T2 corruption prevent the machine to start, so DFU is a tool to fix this problem.
Did you try at least???

You can find 1V1/1V8_SLPS2R at page 63; may exist other in the schematic too (0V8?).
Use the same logic to find AWAKE voltages...

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
i did try the DFU  as per [MEDIA=youtube]C_JLkLqbpv4[/MEDIA] and still not signs of life 

PP1V8_SLPS2R   = 1.8V
PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.2.v
PP1V1_SLPS2R = 1.1 v

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
I said usefull information is already posted on the forum...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://mrmacintosh.com/how-to-restore-bridgeos-on-a-t2-mac-how-to-put-a-mac-into-dfu-mode/[/URL]

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: Thanks I will give a try, sorry to pissing you off bro, I am new to this mac repair stuff.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I have tried the DFU mode repair and I get this error message when doing a revive device.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
Did you test all explained on that tutorial?
Did you use a second Mac with SAME macOS installed as in T2 one?

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I have a Source Macbook Pro running for the Host Mac running BigSur, I guess I have to find a mac that is running Catalina and try again

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I guess I can also Install, Boot, and Run Mac OS X From an External Hard Drive which would be a quicker option

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
I am still having no luck with Restoring BridgeOS on a T2 Mac, I am running MacOS Cataline 10.15.5 and the DFU mode comes up fine so it is detecting the target mac. i am using the latest Apple Configurator 2.13.2 , when I do a revive or a restore I get the following error message, (See picture attached)
Looked over this forum and the internet and can't find what this error means.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I have tried the Restore BridgeOS on a T2 Mac and it does not work, I get DFU mode and I am running the right versions of MACOS and Apple Configurator (See attached error message)

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I have followed the instructions to Restore BridgeOS on a T2 Mac and I have the correct Mac OS Version and the latest Apple Configurator version, alas I get an error (See attached image) .

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message: I now manged to get passed this error message by unplugging the screen connector , I was then able to run the Revive command, I now need to get a new screen and all should be fine.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
Thanks for the feedback about bypassing error removing the internal LCD.
This will help another members for sure.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air A2179
threads.message:
This error might also happen if Battery has a fault as well. Also below is a good article about how to install MacOS on a portable hard drive that you can boot a Macbook off of.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.online-tech-tips.com/mac-os-x/install-boot-and-run-mac-os-x-from-an-external-hard-drive/[/URL]
